discussion_comments.comment_body:
_⚠️ Potential issue_

**Incorrect authentication method usage**  
The snippet calls `.setSession("")`, which doesn’t match the standard Java SDK surface. For API key auth use `.setKey("<YOUR_API_KEY>")`, or for JWT auth use `.setJWT("<YOUR_JWT>")`. Update to the correct client method.

<details>
<summary>🧰 Tools</summary>

<details>
<summary>🪛 LanguageTool</summary>

[duplication] ~9-~9: Possible typo: you repeated a word.
Context: ... The user session to authenticate with  Databases databases = new Databases(client);  databases.cre...

(ENGLISH_WORD_REPEAT_RULE)

</details>

</details>

<details>
<summary>🤖 Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In docs/examples/1.6.x/server-kotlin/java/databases/create-documents.md around
lines 5 to 9, the client initialization incorrectly uses .setSession("") for
authentication, which is not part of the standard Java SDK. Replace
.setSession("") with the appropriate authentication method: use
.setKey("<YOUR_API_KEY>") for API key authentication or .setJWT("<YOUR_JWT>")
for JWT authentication to correctly authenticate the client.
```

</details>
